intro: Adinandra formosana var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan adinandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Taiwan and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a smooth surface, while the flowers are usually white or pale pink. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
